content.question: A bar is attached to a pivot at one end of the bar, as shown, and initially held in place in a horizontal orientation above the ground. The bar is then released and swings with negligible friction about the pivot. The bar passes through the labeled orientations <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> before momentarily coming to rest at orientation <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>D</mtext></math>. In which of the following orientations, if any, is the bar in rotational equilibrium about the pivot?

choices.label: <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>
The bar is not in rotational equilibrium in any of the orientations.
